DataElement.definition: The text for reporting information about race based on the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) categories.
DataElement.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute
DataElement.changeDescription: 3/1/22 jk Designated, added CDS alt name and CSI. 7/17/18 jk revised MCL Core CSI mapping. 05/25/2016 wz added NWU CS/CSI.5/18/16 jk moved from EDRN to MCL context CSI.  3/7/16 jk added MCL Clinical CSI. 12/11/14 jc added Exceptional Responder CSI.  12/10/14 jc added CDUS Rave Integration CSI.
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 10/29/24 per Henry/CodeMap task, add alt table LS;10/2/24 added TCIA Recommended CDE's CSI. bf;2024.5.29 Alt SN added per ticket request CADSR0003787. ak 12/31/23 Added CDS Imaging CSI. jk;  9/6/23 removed CrDC coding instruction limiting PV responses per RR. jk;  5/4/23:classified and added CTDC ALTname for ECOG/DD. LS 4/6/23 Added PCDC Demographics parent CSI. mr;  1/18/23 Added CDS alt def; ref doc EXAMPLE; removed general CDS CSI, added CDS|Participant CSI; per metadata template. mr

DataElementConcept.definition: The category describing the race of the individual.

ObjectClass.definition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.

Property.definition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.definition: racial origination based on OMB approved categories.
ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed per harmonization effort. Added Not allowed to collect to support GDC data dictionary. mc 3.6.19

ValueMeaning.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintains tribal affiliation or community attachment. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: Individuals with origins in any of the original peoples of North, Central, and South America, including, for example, Navajo Nation, Blackfeet Tribe of the Blackfeet Indian Reservation of Montana, Native Village of Marrow Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, Aztec, and Maya.

PermissibleValues.value: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

ValueMeaning.longName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
ValueMeaning.definition: Denotes a person having origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands. The term covers particularly people who identify themselves as part-Hawaiian, Native Hawaiian, Guamanian or Chamorro, Carolinian, Samoan, Chuukese (Trukese), Fijian, Kosraean, Melanesian, Micronesian, Northern Mariana Islander, Palauan, Papua New Guinean, Pohnpeian, Polynesian, Solomon Islander, Tahitian, Tokelauan, Tongan, Yapese, or Pacific Islander, not specified.

Concepts.longName: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander
Concepts.definition: Individuals with origins in any of the original peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands, including, for example, Native Hawaiian, Samoan, Chamorro, Tongan, Fijian, and Marshallese.

ValueMeaning.definition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/5/24 Removed "Unknown Tumor Status" as CRDC Alt Name; no current association with a CRDC CDE or VD. jk

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.definition: A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian subcontinent, including for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam. (OMB)

Concepts.definition: Individuals with origins in any of the original peoples of Central or East Asia, Southeast Asia, or South Asia including, for example, Chinese, Asian Indian, Filipino, Vietnamese, Korean, and Japanese.

ValueMeaning.definition: Denotes person with European, Middle Eastern, or North African ancestral origin who identifies, or is identified, as White.

Concepts.definition: Individuals with origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, including for example, English, German, Irish, Italian, Polish, and Scottish.

ValueMeaning.definition: A person having origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa. Terms such as "Haitian" or "Negro" can be used in addition to "Black or African American". (OMB)

Concepts.definition: Individuals with origins in any of the Black racial groups of Africa, including, for example, African American, Jamaican, Haitian, Nigerian, Ethiopian. and Somali.

ValueMeaning.definition: An indicator that specifies that a collection event was not permitted.

Concepts.definition: An indicator that specifies that a collection event was not permitted.

ConceptualDomain.definition: general description of an individual's physical appearance and vital status.

RepresentationTerm.definition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ReferenceDocuments.documentText: Definition of basic template data elements for Race and Ethnicity.
Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander
Race to be listed as 'Unknown' and Ethnicity as 'Hispanic' if race was originally reported as 'Hispanic'.
How would you describe your racial background?
Which one of these groups would you say BEST represents your race?
What is your race? Check all that apply
Race: African American, Asian, Caucasian, Native American, Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander, Unknown/Other
Enter race with multiple races separated by pipe character (|). Example: Asian|White
